data.text: Be not jealous over the wife of thy bosom,
Give not thy soul unto a woman,
Go not to meet a woman that playeth the harlot,
Use not the company of a woman that is a singer,
Gaze not on a maid, lest haply thou be trapped in her penalties.
Give not thy soul unto harlots,
Look not round about thee in the streets of the city,
Turn away thine eye from a comely woman,
Sit not at all with a woman that hath a husband; A line of this verse is here omitted by the best authorities.
Envy not the glory of a sinner;
Delight not in the delights of the ungodly:
Keep thee far from the man that hath Or, authority  power to kill,
As well as thou canst, guess at thy neighbours;
Let thy converse be with men of understanding;
Let just men be the companions of thy board;
For the hand of the artificers a work shall be commended:
A man full of tongue is dangerous in his city;
